channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Trump doubles down on replacing income taxes with tariffs in Joe Rogan interview
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has attacked the tariff policy proposed by Donald Trump, calling it effectively a "sales tax" on Americans.

item.title: Biden says Elon Musk was an 'illegal worker' when he began U.S. career
item.description: Elon Musk has become a regular campaign surrogate for Donald Trump in the presidential race against Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: German finance minister warns of retaliation if U.S. kicks off trade war
item.description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Friday warned that if the U.S. kicked off a trade war with the European Union, there could be retaliation.

item.title: Jeff Bezos killed Washington Post endorsement of Kamala Harris, paper reports
item.description: The Washington Post planned to endorse Kamala Harris over Donald Trump before owner Jeff Bezos, the Amazon founder, decided against it, the newspaper reported.

item.title: Elon Musk's secret talks with Putin ramped up during his Twitter takeover: WSJ report
item.description: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has engaged in secret talks with Vladimir Putin since late 2022, The Wall Street Journal reports.

item.title: Warren Buffett — worried about impersonators — says he doesn't endorse candidates or investments
item.description: Buffett's actions were triggered in part by a fake political endorsement alerted to him on Meta's Instagram.

item.title: Elon Musk is $26 billion richer after Tesla's best day on the stock market since 2013
item.description: Tesla shares soared 22% on Thursday, lifting the world's richest person's net worth by roughly $26 billion.

item.title: Delta sues CrowdStrike after widespread IT outage that caused thousands of cancellations
item.description: Delta is seeking damages for its losses from the July IT incident, as well as litigation costs and punitive damages.

item.title: What McDonald's needs to do next after E. coli outbreak
item.description: Health authorities are investigating the source of the E. coli outbreak that has sickened 75 and led to one death.

item.title: How United is trying to overtake Delta as the world's most profitable airline
item.description: United Airlines has been trying to expand its profits by investing heavily in roomier seats and growing a network that will excite high-spending travelers.

item.title: Abercrombie ex-CEO Mike Jeffries pleads not guilty in sex crimes case
item.description: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries, his partner Matthew Smith and associate James Jacobson face sex trafficking and interstate prostitution charges.

item.title: Cruise lines are having a moment as a popular — and cheaper — alternative to hotels
item.description: The pricing gap between cruises and land-based lodging is even wider than it appears, according to UBS.

item.title: Russia's central bank raises key rate to 21% to rein in higher-than-forecast inflation
item.description: Russia's central bank on Friday raised its key interest rate by 200 basis points to 21%, citing higher-than-forecast consumer price increases.

item.title: Inflation undershoots to jumbo cuts: What 10 European Central Bank members said this week
item.description: A slew of Governing Council members spoke to CNBC at the International Monetary Fund's annual meeting in Washington, D.C. this week.

item.title: New York Stock Exchange to extend after-hours trading
item.description: Trading would open at 1:30 a.m. and end at 11:30 p.m. ET on weekdays on the Arca electronics exchange, if approved by regulators.

item.title: China schedules meeting expected to reveal fiscal stimulus details
item.description: Investors have been awaiting the gathering of the standing committee of the National People's Congress, watchful for details on any fiscal stimulus.

item.title: Malaysia must avoid 'boom-bust' cycles to finally claim Asian Tiger status, central bank governor says
item.description: Governor of Malaysian Central Bank has high hopes that 'Asian Tiger' status is near

item.title: Microsoft CEO Nadella asked for pay reduction after security slip, but total comp still rose 63%
item.description: Following cyberattacks from China and Russia, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella asked for his pay to be reduced.

item.title: South and North Korea troops potentially entering Ukraine war unlikely to stoke regional conflict, analysts say
item.description: The U.S. has confirmed that North Korean troops have been sent to Russia, with Ukraine President Zelenskyy pegging the North Korean troop count at 12,000.

item.title: Apple returns to top 5 smartphone ranking in China with iPhone 16 as Huawei battle ramps up
item.description: Apple returned to the top five ranking of China's smartphone market, helped by the launch of the iPhone 16, but its growth was still outpaced by Huawei.

item.title: As the West watches Xi-Putin meetings, China touts crackdown on military goods to Russia
item.description: Beijing has walked a diplomatic tightrope throughout the Russia-Ukraine war.

item.title: Major airlines are cutting services to China or quitting entirely amid low travel demand, high costs
item.description: A new report from travel news site Skift shows that seven major airlines have retreated from the country in the past four months.

item.title: China's steel exports expected to falter in 2025 as pain from tariffs spread
item.description: Steel producers in China face a double-whammy of mounting overseas tariffs and weakened domestic demand at home.

item.title: 'Made in Mexico' trade controversy is provoking another kind of border war
item.description: Chinese and European companies that manufactured in China are moving to Mexico, with billions invested in new trade strategies, and political battles to come.

item.title: Why the Japanese yen is hovering near three-month lows against the dollar
item.description: The yen hit a low of 153.18 against the greenback, its weakest since July 31.

item.title: Tesla stock soars 22% for best day in over a decade on Musk's 2025 growth projection
item.description: Tesla shares soared 22% Thursday, the stock's best day in 11 years, following its better-than-expected third-quarter earnings.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: In this time of uncertainty, logic is driving market moves
item.description: The fact that we can draw a line, however fuzzy, connecting cause to effect suggests investors are scrutinizing earnings and news in a period of uncertainty.

item.title: French trader bet over $28 million on Trump election win using 4 Polymarket accounts
item.description: Supporters of Donald Trump, including Elon Musk, have touted shifting election odds on Polymarket even as polls largely show a tight race with Kamala Harris.

item.title: Nvidia doubles down on India with Hindi language model and major partnerships
item.description: Nvidia on Thursday announced a slew of partnerships with major Indian firms and launched a Hindi language model.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Why did India's biggest market listing this year falter on its debut?
item.description: Some cite the IPO's key elements as factors in its faltering stock market debut. Others say sitting on the sidelines means losing out on long-term gains.
